Articles.Content:
Here is my new shuttle craft the Newton II. It is capable of undocking from a space station landing and getting back into orbit whilst carrying 3 crew members. I can take off vertically on both airless and atmospheric worlds as well horizontal flight. It is a relitivly small but very powerfull and capable ship. Here is an imgur album of it completing the SSI certification run.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Here is the flight profile and keybindings for the craft:

1. Press 1 and 2 until you reach 80m/s

2. Then press 1 to disengage the basic jet engine

3. Now put your nose up to 50 degrees until 26,000m

4. Flatten out to gain speed

5. You should only need to stay between 0 and 20 degrees to maintain altitude

6. You should be able to get up to about 2000 - 2100m/s before the engines go closed cycle

7. Watch the rapier engines when they go to closed cycle press 3 and 5 and try to get to 70km

8. Press 2 once 70km is reached to deactivate the Rapiers

9. Circularize orbit to about 70x 70km using the Lv-n engine.

10. The shuttle is capable of refueling at 120km landing at KSC and getting back to a 120km orbit.

Make sure once you land to put the rapiers into automatic mode.

1. Basic Jet

2. Rapiers

3. Intakes

4. Switch Rapier mode

5. LV- N

6. Non atmospheric Vtol engine

7. Retract/ Extend Ladders

8. Undock with the Universal docking port.

I hope you enjoy the craft and here is the downloadd link:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/uiydv3f0ogbmbyb/SSI%20Newton%20II%20%28Type-3%20Shuttlecraft%29.craft

Any comments would be appreciated and I hope you enjoy the craft.
